Early and intense wildfire season has arrived around the Mediterranean
subhead: As of July 8, some 214,000 hectares have been ravaged by flames in the European Union, more than double the average. Fires have broken out further north in Europe, and the eastern Mediterranean region has also been struck.

The young Gazans killed at Al-Baqa café
subhead: On June 30, an Israeli airstrike killed dozens in a Gaza City café. Many young professionals, who embody Gazan resilience after 21 devastating months of war, died that day. Here are the stories of four of them.

title: Netanyahu 'deeply' expresses regret after Israeli strike hits Gaza church, killing three and wounding priest
subhead: An Israeli strike on the only Catholic church in Gaza killed three people on Thursday, church officials said, and wounded 10 others, including a priest who was close to the late Pope Francis.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Tour de France: Pogacar reclaims yellow jersey with dominant solo win
subhead: Tadej Pogacar stormed to victory on stage 12 of the Tour de France Thursday, dropping his rivals on the Hautacam climb to retake the overall lead.

title: In 1945, 'Elle' instantly set a new standard for French women's magazines
subhead: 'The Summer of 1945' (4/6). Hélène Gordon-Lazareff, who spent much of World War Two in the United States, returned to France with fresh ideas for the press. She promised her readers 'seriousness in frivolity, irony in gravity.'

Gaza: Video verified by Le Monde shows gunfire near food distribution center
subhead: The video was filmed in Rafah, nearly 900 meters from a Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid distribution center. According to the United Nations, over 800 people have been killed in Gaza since the end of May while trying to access humanitarian aid.
byline: By Juliette Prigent, Asia Balluffier, Elisa Bellanger and Julian Mathews

title: 'His return was a miracle, but he had changed': The first free summer of Lyon's Holocaust survivors
subhead: 'The Summer of 1945' (3/6). As Lyon celebrated the Liberation, survivors of the death camps tried to reconnect with daily life, despite hardship, silence, and widespread incomprehension.

title: 'Soldiers found us and told us to undress': In Ethiopia, silence shrouds Tigray war's mass rapes
subhead: During the war in Tigray, in Ethiopia, 120,000 women were victims of rape. More than two and a half years since the end of the conflict, many survivors are still trying to overcome their trauma, with justice yet to be served.
